company_context: Next Generation Treasury Management Platform | TREASY Request a Demo Linkedin X-twitter Home TREASY Next Generation Treasury Platform Discover the Future of Finance with TREASY: A Secure and Scalable Cloud-Based Treasury Management Platform. Request a demo Master Treasury Management with TREASY Empower your financial team with real-time insights and seamless control through our cloud-based treasury management platform. Cloud-Based Treasury Management TREASY operates as a fully cloud-native fintech solution, thus streaming complex financial functions and simplifying treasury management. Moreover, it provides seamless and affordable access to essential services like Foreign Exchange (FX), Fixed Income (FI), and Money Market (MM). As a result, with TREASY, financial services are more accessible, efficient, and flexible than ever before. Compliance Simplified Navigating the regulatory landscape is challenging, especially for fintechs aiming to meet stringent financial system requirements. However, TREASY’s Treasury Regulatory Compliance (TRC) module ensures that your organization stays ahead of evolving regulatory obligations, making compliance an integral part of your operations without the headaches. Adapt to Market Competition In today’s fast-moving market, time to market (TTM) can make or break a financial product’s success. Therefore, TREASY accelerates product development, allowing organizations to quickly introduce innovative solutions. Reduce delays and stay competitive with TREASY’s advanced tools that cut down on the time and resources required to bring new products to market. Modernization Made Easy with Treasy TREASY acts as an advanced parallel core for incumbent banks, offering a streamlined pathway to modernization. From articulating and configuring financial products to launching them efficiently, TREASY enables banks to modernize their operations with ease and agility, making complex processes simple and quick to implement. Composable Banking & Treasury Solution TREASY is a cutting-edge, cloud-based treasury management platform, offering a composable banking platform built on SaaS architecture and powered by the cloud. Moreover, it utilizes Microservices, where API-like, definition-based systems manage core banking and financial transactions with precision and efficiency. TREASY’s engines receive standardized input messages from UIs or integrated services and return standardized responses, ensuring smooth and reliable operations. This shared service model allows any TREASY modules or external services to seamlessly call upon its capabilities. Dynamic & Parametric Systems TREASY’s dynamic, parametric systems are designed to meet a variety of common financial business requirements, including dynamic accounting, FX market transactions, money market management, and rate distribution. By using definition-based systems, TREASY makes development faster and more efficient, allowing teams to focus on module-specific requirements while reducin

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Hi, my name is Alex and I'm a Sales Development Representative at DeepData AI. I came across your company, Treasy, and was impressed with your next-generation treasury management platform. I'd like to introduce our data processing solution, which can help enhance your platform's performance and provide valuable insights.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: Ah, thanks for reaching out, Alex. I'm John, the CTO here at Treasy. We're always looking for ways to improve our platform, but I have to say, we've already invested heavily in a data processing solution with one of your competitors. What makes DeepData AI so unique that it would be worth considering a switch?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: That's a great question, John. Our solution offers advanced machine learning capabilities and real-time data processing, which can help you make more informed decisions and stay ahead of the competition. We've seen significant ROI for our clients in the fintech space. I'd love to schedule a demo to show you the capabilities of our platform.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: I appreciate the offer, but as I mentioned, we're already locked into a contract with another provider. We've just started to see some returns on that investment, and switching now would be a significant undertaking, not to mention the costs associated with integration and potential downtime. How does your pricing compare to what we're currently paying?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Our pricing is competitive, and we offer flexible plans to accommodate different business needs. However, I understand that integration and downtime are significant concerns. We've had success with similar implementations in the past and can provide a dedicated support team to ensure a smooth transition. Would you be open to discussing this further with our technical team to see if we can address some of those concerns?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: I appreciate your willingness to work with us, Alex, but to be honest, we're not looking to make any significant changes to our infrastructure at this time. We're focused on expanding our treasury management platform and don't have the bandwidth to take on a new project like this. Plus, our current contract has a pretty significant penalty for early termination, so it's just not feasible for us to consider switching right now.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I completely understand, John. It sounds like you have a lot on your plate, and I respect that. If I could just leave you with some information about DeepData AI and our solution, perhaps we could revisit this conversation in the future when your contract is up for renewal?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: Thank you, Alex, but I think we'll have to pass on DeepData AI for now. As I said, we're committed to our current contract, and it's just not the right time for us to consider a change. I appreciate your understanding, and I wish you and your company all the best.

analysis.raw:
Score: 4
Outcome: Failure
Key_Objection: Integration
Feedback: The seller should have more aggressively addressed the buyer's concerns about integration and contract penalties earlier in the conversation to potentially find a workaround or alternative solution. Sentiment: Neutral
